But regular batteries are big and to build a really small and portable camera, the lithium-ion is the way to go - light, powerful and small.I use Picassa and iPhoto for photo management so I did not have a chance to play with the included CDs (2 CDs came with the box).Pros:+ ease of use+ 1600 ISO for a point and shoot is amazing+ stabilization works good+ great camera interface+ fast start up. It is ready to shoot almost as soon as you turn the camera on.+ huge LCD screen+ entry level price+ sleek, good looks, the ooooohs and the aaaaahs+ as opposed to regular NiMh batteries, lthiumi-ion batteries remain charged even up to 18 months. That means you always have the camera ready to shoot anytime you pick it up.+ portability. Now i can bring a camera everywhere I go. My 2 megapix phone is not good enoughCons:- bland colors- no viewfinder- slow zooming on both shooting and playback- zoom is not operational during video captureBuck for buck, with all the functionality and characteristics, this cam is a winner----------------SEE actual sample video and pics on the comment section.

Reviews.Title: Easy-to-use digital camera is a great choice for the price
Reviews.Author: Shevi "FantasyWeaver"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a cheap camera that's easy to use and takes great pictures, the Fuji FinePix J28 is a pretty good choice.It's light-weight, attractive and very compact, fitting easily into a pocket or a purse. There are very few buttons on the back and the icons are fairly easy to understand. On screen choices are written in plain English. While there are several settings to choose from--portrait, landscape, night, macro, night portrait, backlight portrait and panorama--I only used the auto setting for all the shots I took, and I was very pleased with the results.  The colors were good, the sharpness of the photos was excellent, so much so that I could blow up just a small part of a picture and still have a great picture.I was particularly impressed by the camera's ability to take pictures in low light. Indoor pictures are so bright they look like they were taken outdoors, and pictures taken at twilight look like they were taken at sunset. I was also impressed that the automatic red-eye correction actually works. I've seen other cameras that claim to have this feature still take pictures with red eye, but so far no red eye with this camera. I was a little less impressed with the anti-blur feature. It's pretty good, but I still found some blurring here and there. The camera is relatively quick to take a picture, which is great. The last thing you want is for the scene you're trying to take a picture of to disappear as your subject walks away between the time you press on the button and the camera snaps the picture.  I haven't found that a problem with this camera.The display is a decent size, but there's no viewfinder. This bothers me for two reasons: first, the constant use of the digital display eats up the battery's power, and second, it can be fairly difficult to make out what you're taking a picture of when sunlight is reflecting off the display.  If I could change a few things on this camera, it would be add a viewfinder, increase the optical zoom, and add a wide-angle lens. Granted, the crispness of the photos mean you can "zoom" in at home when you manipulate your pictures on your computer, and a wide-angle lens would let in less light, which means the night and indoor shots wouldn't be as impressive as they are, so there are advantages to the way the camera is.One more thing if you're planning to buy this camera: remember to get a SDHC card! With a 10 megapixel camera, you're going to need it. 2-4 GB should be fine.So if you're looking for an affordable, easy-to-use digital camera to capture the special moments in your life, the Fuji FinePix J28 is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my new Fuji
Reviews.Author: Lady zenomi "zenomi"
Reviews.Content: I received my camera a couple days ago..I was a bit worried initially about purchasing this brand of camera but went with the reviews. The quality of pictures are breath taking, easy to use not very complicated..I had issues with the fact that the in the box user manual was not in depth and I had to use the cd to read the full manual. also the internal memory is not much. To benefit the most a memory card is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: Bala "indiaj0nes"
Reviews.Content: I have many different brands of digital cameras over the years - Canon,Sony, Panasonic..I found this camera the best value for money -1) Crisp Pictures!2) Decent battery life3) Slim and comparable to Sony W220 for lesser price4) Superb low light pictures(No reddish, grainy pics)5) Nice Macro PicturesI bought this for $69 bucks include case + 2GB card!What a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, nice zoom
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "CandysRaves"
Reviews.Content: My husband is bad at taking pictures. Really bad. I am not talking about cutting off heads, that I could handle. He just cannot take a clear or properly lit picture. The FinePix J28 helps out...a LOT!He has another camera that is pretty good, too. The only differences between these two is 1.) Price and 2.) Resolution. However, in both cases the differences are really small. $20 price difference for 2 extra megapixels? Not really noticeable.This camera seems to have all of the standard features: optical zoom, face detection, auto-stabilization. I really did not find anything here that made it stand out.Over all: This is a standard compact digital camera. If that is what you need, then this should fit the bill. However, if you are looking for something more "high end", you'd be better off looking at more expensive models.I am rating this 4 stars as compared to other, similar cameras. It doesn't really stand out, but it doesn't fall behind either. And the price helps up the rating a bit too, for this pricepoint, it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price but not good close up picture quality
Reviews.Author: Snail Dealer "Snail"
Reviews.Content: This is a special camera for me because even though I've been buying things like this as gift to parents, I've never owned one myself. This is the first one I "own."I love the panoramic view option, it's great. It's not perfect, though, because the person taking the picture is required to take three pictures and do his or her best to "connect" them. The camera does what it can to adjust, but ultimately it takes steady hands to "line up" the three photos. Doesn't look too bad, though.I also like the sports option which takes a shot on moving objects without the blur. I was skeptical at first, but when I turned to this option and took a picture, it worked.I've used it an afternoon on and off and an evening playing with it. Battery still full. This is a good sign, even though I did buy an extra battery.Close up pictures are a bit pathetic, though, even with the "macro" and "close up" options. Zoom is not powerful, but for the price I guess it's fine. Standing on the ground I couldn't focus in on the top of the capital building, but for 3x digital zoom I guess I can't expect that to happen?Over all, great for under $80 because for the deal I got, it included a camera bag and a 2gb card.

Reviews.Title: Foolproof camera
Reviews.Author: B. MORLOCK
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use right out of the box, takes great pictures and has more than enough settings to satisfy anyone. Taking the panoramic views has to be the highlight of this camera, very easy to do and the pictures even at night turn out awesome. The only thing I have to complain about is that just bought this camera a week ago and Amazon dropped the price $30.

Reviews.Title: Simplicity
Reviews.Author: Canned Heat
Reviews.Content: After receiving the Fujifil FinePlex J28 Camera, I promptly gave it to my daughter.  There isn't much in terms of bells and whistles, and for many, that is a good thing.  Very straight forward in function, and takes adequate pictures.  As long as you don't expect the picture quality to meet or exceed that of your DSLR, then this camera may suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Fail: Disappointing Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: BargainHunter9
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera packaged with a 2 GB flash memory card and a CaseLogic camera case for only $80 on Black Friday, but I really wish I had held out for a more expensive digital camera with better features.Despite the impressive resolution and basic features available to beginners, this Fujifilm FinePix J28 leaves a lot to be desired. Three reasons that make this product a dealbreaker:1. Digital Zoom v. Optical Zoom: The optical zoom advertised is more or less non-existent. All the zoom feature does is enlarge a portion of the image, `simulating' optical zoom. In other words, the camera crops a portion of the image and then enlarges it back to size. In so doing, you lose image quality. If you've been regularly using digital zoom and wondered why your pictures did not look that great, now you know.2. Auto-Scene Selection: This is one of the 15+ picture settings offered and one of two 'Auto' options, but Auto-Scene only picks from about half the total photo-shooting scenarios available. The Auto-Scene setting is good at detecting landscapes and flowers as subjects, but is unreliable other scenarios, especially in low lighting. You might be better off just leaving the setting on Auto or manually picking a setting from the list. You might not see a difference, if at all, between some of the other settings, such as Text and Flower or Sport and Party.3. Menu Nesting & Accessibility: The timer option is easily accessible with a shortcut button, but the video mode is buried beneath two menu levels, so if you're the type of photographer who needs to take a lightning-fast video of an endangered bird or a celebrity leaving a restaurant, expect to miss a lot of opportunities.Fujifilm is known for the quality of its color and negative films, instant cameras, and printer products, but not really for its digital cameras.There's a reason for that.If you want to invest in reliable, affordable, run-of-the-mill point-and-shoot digital camera, stick with the reputable digital camera makers who've been doing it well all along: Canon, Olympus, and Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: mlm
Reviews.Content: I have compared the pics on this camera to some of the more expensive brands and you cannot tell the difference. I would definitely say GREAT buy for this camera. Money well spent!

Reviews.Title: Dreaded Zoom Error on my camera
Reviews.Author: mama of 2 boys "mama of 2 boys"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera Christmas 2009. I LOVED this camera until last week, I got an zoom error on the camera and the lens would not move anymore.  When you turn it on, it just says "zoom error." It will not budge and the manual says I will have to send it in (no trouble shooting for this).  Unfortunately when I logged on today to see other customer reviews I am very disappointed to find that this is a common problem with fuji.  Further, they will be charging $$ to fix this instead of honoring the warranty!  I am so bummed.  $100 down the drain!  The camera didn't even last one year.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Service Stinks
Reviews.Author: WC
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last Christmas and about 6 months later the lens would not come out of the camera.I sent it to Fuji for repair and they sent me a bill for $91.25.  I will never ever ever buy a Fuji camera again.This was the first and it will be the last.  I know I should have bought a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Broke in a month
Reviews.Author: KS
Reviews.Content: This camera had a zoom error after just a month.  Sent to Fuji, but they would not cover it under warranty saying that something got stuck in the lens.  The local camera stores looked at it and advised that the cost of repair would be higher than the value of the camera.  Waste of money!One camera store recommended I replace it with a Canon.  I think I will.

Reviews.Title: fuji j28
Reviews.Author: Gerald Uyeda "gerald"
Reviews.Content: i haven't really used it yet, but it seems fine.i realize that there are many savvy people out there, but there are some of us electronics dummies too.  in that light it would have been nice to know that without a memory card the camera can take very few (three?) photos.just a convenience suggestion for the fuji people.  your instructiions come double-sided in three languages.  wouldn't it be nice if page 1 of the english instructions were backed by page 2 of the english instructions rather than page 2 of the spanish instructions?  similarly for spanish.  i think only by chance the french instructions are back-to-back.  should i brush up on my french?

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Halcykon
Reviews.Content: This was a great camera for the price that I bought it for ($80 total with 2gb sd card and carrying case). I've taken some GREAT pictures with this camera and was very surprised at the quality.This camera is definitely for the casual user, as there aren't many functions to control (and few that are, are hard to reach)The video function isn't that bad; you can take some high quality videos.The biggest surprise for me is the panorama function! This little function pieces together three pictures in a row for a panorama. The computer is pretty accurate in piecing the data together.Anyways, here are some examples of photos you can expect from this camera (I tweaked both a little with photoshp though)[...]

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Betty Paone "Danny Seymore"
Reviews.Content: This camera is as good or better than more expensive point and shoots.I am very happy with this camera.I am also very happy with amazon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: K. Nordhus
Reviews.Content: The J28 which is very thin and would quite easily fit into a pocket looks and works like a much more expensive camera model.The pictures are nice and clear. The face detection with red eye removal automatically detects and corrects red eye. It's also very user friendly, which is nice for those of us who would rather not bother with reading the instructions.  I've owned several different digital cameras over the years and this is by far my favorite.

Reviews.Title: STAY AT HOME CAMERA  TOTALLY  SUCKS.......but
Reviews.Author: G.   SHRAMEK
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a camera you would want to take on vacation as the battery will stop working with NO ADVANCED WARNING!! I have had it fully charged, taken 6 pictures and the next time I tried to turn it on it WOULDN'T TURN ON! I'm sure it's not the battery but, rather a circuitry problem. Once in a while I can plug it in the charger, wait until one red light comes on on the camera, turn the camera on while plugged in and it will go on. Then unplug it and it will work fine for a while until it gets the next hair crosswise. Other times this trick don't work and I'll have to leave it on charge overnight. I'm thankful I have a Nikon digital also. The picture quality is great when it's in the  mood to turn on! BUT: I bought one for my daughter before I had this problem and hers works fine!

Reviews.Title: Very easy to put battery in wrong
Reviews.Author: Noelemite "Viva Las Banas"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my Mother as a gift for Xmas 09 to replace a much higher end HP that was more complicated than she liked and took forever to save even the lowest res pics.  She used it briefly over the holidays, liked it fine but her dislike of using her last camera got her out of the habit of taking pics.  Fast Forward to this morning.... Family is visiting and she wanted her camera to capture the memories.  Battery is low, so after we finish tearing apart the house to locate the charge cable we plug it in and ... nothing.  Dead.  Take out the battery...  make sure the contacts line up... they do.  I remove the mem card; take out battery; take out both mem card and battery... no luck.  Check to make sure the outlet's got power - It does.  Test the cable on another device... cable's good.  When we're out of ideas, I go online only to discover people are reporting a bunch of sthese  Find out this is a common problem.  Nose around a bit, try some other troubleshooting solutions... See a couple posts which suggest turning the battery over - but they have a different model than ours, and there's only one way the battery will fit in this model.  Besides, I'm not that stupid.Well, that's where I was wrong.  Even though the battery is shaped like those preventing improper insertion - think of a miniUSB plug that's wider on the bottom than the top - that's not the case.  I flipped the battery over so that the side of the battery bearing a circle design is facing the same direction as the lens and inserted it brass-contacts-end first.  Bingo!I consider myself a pretty tech savvy guy.  I'm no expert, but I've built computers, and have been a technophile for over two decades, this one got past me. It's so obvious, and I felt pretty dumb doing it, but it worked.  My cam's not dead and I'm not eating the postage to send it in for repairs that it doesn't need; so before purchasing an addiional charger or new bateries try flipping it over.Haven't run enough pics thru it to give it a review other than to say, battery issues aside, it's pretty idiot-proof and does everything it's advertised to do.  I got this one with a case and 2 gig card as a combo for about 80 bucks.  At that price you can't expect top end Photographic equipment, if it lasts a couple years, it'll be a great buy.  Chuck it like a bic lighter, or a carnival goldfish and get another.

Reviews.Title: Same story here, camera died after one use.
Reviews.Author: T. Winton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas.  She used it one time, and now the camera will not power on.  We have tried replacing the battery and that did not help.  This seems to be a common problem as I see a few recent reviews whose cameras also will not power on.  So, now I need to spend money to ship it to Fuji so they can send me a refurbed unit back.  This is a bunch of crap, if I wanted a refurb, I would have bought refurb.

Reviews.Title: Nice Package, but Died 5 Wks After Christmas
Reviews.Author: JusttheGoodStuff
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my son who is deploying overseas.  He received it for Christmas, and by the time he came home in early Feb for leave prior to his departure, the CCD had apparently died.  He bought a new camera, lacking time to get this one repaired.  So we can get it fixed and have an extra camera, or return it for credit and swallow the cost of the battery and extra memory.Seemed like a nice package, but I can't say I'm impressed by the quality.  Wish I'd stuck with Canon.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jack W. Wolfe
Reviews.Content: Well this is a great little digital camera. First the size is just right for us we took it on our last ride and took alot of pics and then took the card and put it in our printer and the shots turned out just great. It was easy to use it fit in my case I keep on my belt and when we needed it it worked great eveytime The battery life was good we charged it at night and took pics all day long.(maybe 40 or 50 pics in a day). the manuel was easy to read and eveything worked fine the self timer was very easy to use we used it alot it give you plenty of time to get set to take the picture. So over all I would say this was a GREAT little camera to take on our trip whan you go on a bike size does matter and this worked just fine!!! WORTH EVERY PENNY!! thank you!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix J28 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a digital camera and saw this one on Amazon.com. What sold me were the pictures that people had taken. Thay were so clean and crisp! I kept waiting for the price to go down where it would be more affordable but i ended up getting the same one on Ebay for 50.00 less. It is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Picture quality could have been better
Reviews.Author: Deepak Jujare
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera during Black Friday 2009 as I needed a cheap camera to give as a gift to family in India. I wanted to try it out before I gave it to them and felt that the pictures in the night were not that clear, even when I changed the setting to night.Overall the picture quality could have been better, but for the price that I paid, its good enough.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Camera for Still Shots
Reviews.Author: K. Hill
Reviews.Content: This camera can take some nice pictures, but has a noticeable lag between the time the shutter release button is pressed and the actual moment the picture is taken.  The lack can lead to missed shots especially when you are trying to catch special moments.  This became a little less of an issue as I got to know the camera, but I still have more of those moments after pictures than I wish.  Outdoor still shots and text shots seem to be best, which is nice, but indoor shots can be a little washed out under some indoor lighting situations, and if you are looking to take shots in the middle of a lot of action, this probably is not the camera for you.  Overall, I like this camera, but I am a little disappointed with some of its limitations.3 out of 5 stars

Reviews.Title: did not work after one day
Reviews.Author: Katherine J. Korpi "customer #1"
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for the first day, but would not hole a charge on the second, after being charged for several hours.

Reviews.Title: average camera
Reviews.Author: Harsh
Reviews.Content: As this model is for UK and you might have problem if you need some support/repair.I have try to register it online but on US web this model is not listed so i was not able to register.The picture quality is average and some time auto mode may not give better result so you may need to set the shooting mode in their actual requirement(like night mode,snow,sport etc).It's quality is as per the price!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: David M. Gray
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  The only complaint is I wish these smaller cameras had less lag time between photos, but I would have to lug around a much larger SLR to accomplish this.  I love how it recognizes what you are trying to take a photo of.  I took a photo of a flower and it recognized it and took a great shot.

Reviews.Title: Budget Quality at a Budget Price
Reviews.Author: E. David Swan
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth digital camera I've owned and so far my favorite has been the Olympus FE-340 8.0 m with 5x optical zoom. I had written an entire review comparing the two camera's with the point being that my venerable Olympus took better photos then the much newer Fujifilm FinePix. This was the plan until I discovered that my Olympus was selling on Amazon for $343.98 compared to the $99.95 listed price of the FinePix. I can assure you I paid nothing close to the $340 when I bought the Olympus at Circuit City last year but it wouldn't be fair to compare the two since the FinePix is clearly a budget priced camera. Just holding the two in my hands I can feel the much higher quality of craftsmanship in the Olympus and the only thing the FinePix seemed to be superior in was in the crispness of detail in blown up pictures which is exactly what I would expect given its higher pixel count.The FinePix is a budget camera with budget quality. It's worthless on night shots and unlike my Olympus doesn't keep the shutter open long enough to allow in any light (not that the Olympus takes great night shot). I had a real tough time with close up shots in flower (macro) mode and continually got the red reticule of doom. When I tried to take a picture of a pepper growing in my garden the FinePix stubbornly refused to focus on the pepper no matter how I adjusted and always focused on the ground (which did look stunningly clear). I took some close up photos of my herb garden and I have to say that in this case the FinePix was both clearer and more natural looking than the Olympus. If you're looking to take crisp close up shots I would definitely recommend a camera with a 5x optical zoom.On tough shots the FinePix fails but if you're looking to get some easy shots in normal light it works fine. Sometimes I got some graininess on my indoor shots and other times it looked fine. I took a walk around my office shooting pictures of stairwells and hallways and a copier and for a budget prices camera is seemed to do just fine. In fact the indoor close-up shots looked pretty good, you just can't get as close as you can with a 5x optical zoom. Any closer than say 6 to 7 inches and the camera cannot get focus. I took some outdoor shots on a cloudy day and they looked very nice and well detailed. One feature that is unique among all the digital camera's I've owned is that the port for linking the camera to a PC is the same port for charging the lithium battery. I like that but I felt like copying from the camera to the PC took longer than normal. Also, cameras I've had in the past would turn on automatically when I linked it to a PC but I had to turn the FinePix on myself.To summarize this is a budget camera for people who want to take photos under optimal conditions. The daytime landscape shots looked very good but you can feel the cheapness of the camera the moment you take it out of the box. I'll give it four stars because by and large you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed even at low-price point
Reviews.Author: C. Grevstad
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera from Amazon for an amazing price (as usual for Amazon!). However, upon receiving the camera and snapping pictures under different scenarios I became under-impressed very quickly. My previous camera, casio exilim s770, was smashed in a car door accidentally and suffers from some problems. This Fujifilm was my attempt to replace the Casio. Unfortunately it falls terribly short of the expectations set by the former. Particularly low-light shots look grainy and dull. I prefer taking shots without the flash, if at all necessary, to preserve the natural color and ambiance of a scene I'm capturing. The Fujifilm will not cooperate at all with me under these circumstances and using the flash will produce a crisp, but very generic looking shot. This camera may be just what some people want, but for me it lacks the ability to make pictures special/unique. I am in the process of returning this camera in hopes I can repair my Casio.Pros:-Price-Ease of Use-Battery life seemed fine-Pictures look good under safe/standard scenarios (ie: good light, little movement, flash use)-The Panoramic mode is very cool and something my Casio lacks, however not very useful to print or share.Cons:-Build is mostly plastic, feels very light.-Lower-light/night shots are poor-Shutter speed SLOW. You will be waiting several seconds between taking shots. Very frustrating.-Face detection seems spotty at best-Minimal Shot-modes. Definitely geared towards people who will simply keep it on 'Auto' mode.-Nothing really stands out at all that makes this camera special to me

Reviews.Title: after one use, battery died
Reviews.Author: Si Diep Le "rfpro"
Reviews.Content: How am I supposed to feel after giving the camera to the wife for Christmas present, the battery died after initial try? Worst yet, the wife did not open her present untill a couple of weeks ago and thus can not return to Amazon for refund. very disappointed. Thought Fuji put out better product than this! Where is quality control or just another made in China piece of junk?

Reviews.Title: Not good for indoor photos
Reviews.Author: Diamond M. Dominguez "diamon2x"
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera in the mail today.  The indoor photos continuously came out very dark.  I tried adjusting the flash setting, tried manual and auto settings.  Nothing would brighten the faces in the photos. My old sony digital camera from year 2005 is only 4 megapixels and it takes great photos in or outdoors. Also Fuji's directions are "TOO SHORT"!  The directions dont offer any help or suggestions on how to fix the problem I had.  The box had a DVD disc enlcosed for further instructions, but I wasn't going that far after reading thru the directions.  The only reason I bought this Fuji camera is bacause I wanted one of the newer digital camera models which have the BIG DISPLAY WINDOW in the back so that I could see the new snapshots better. That and the low price. Forget it!  Until I can afford a new sony compatable to the older SONY digital that I already have, I wont buy anything else.

Reviews.Title: review of camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah J. Sagisser
Reviews.Content: Camera was suppose to come with a card as well as a case and it didn't come with either one.

Reviews.Title: A Low Picture-Qualiity Camara
Reviews.Author: G. Yuan
Reviews.Content: We found that the picture quality is fairly bad in general. The image could be over-exposed or under exposed.  The background tends to be getting darkened and hard to see in the picture, even the room is well lighted.We also has some trouble when using it outdoor as well.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: D "D"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great for a beginner camera or for one to carry with you, easy to use point and shoot. It is very light weight, small enough to fit in a shirt pocket and takes great pictures. The battery is rechargeable and recharges inside the camera when plugged in, the batteries seem to last a long time too. The LCD screen is large and pleasant to use. It has face detection and scene recognition all helpful in taking a good quality picture, just hold the shutter half way until it focuses then take the pic. This would be a good camera for anyone even electronically challenged people. Even the buttons are intuitive enough to not get confused. The camera seems to be durable and when shut off the lens detracts and closes, protecting the lens with a plastic shield automatically. The pictures are clear and vivid. Win XP and Vista both will recognize the camera without even installing the software, I can use adobe to get the pictures and sort them. This is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: If you have Vista don't buy this camera; software not compatible
Reviews.Author: Todd Elliott
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife as a Christmas gift. Pictures are ok at best. The problem is the software does not work at all with Vista. Customer service tells you that if you have Vista 64 you are out of luck. I have 32 but the download they provide from their site is corrupt. The camera still will not download the photos. Customer service keeps trying to blame my computer but every other companies drivers work fine. Get ready Amazon this camera is coming back.

Reviews.Title: Came out of the box broken
Reviews.Author: M. Gifford
Reviews.Content: This was my 12 YO daughter's main Christmas present. We unpacked it from the box, installed the battery, charged it as instructed, and turned it on only to get an error message - FOCUS ERROR - and have the lens close. According to the User's Guide, there is no fix for this - we're supposed to contact Fuji. It would be nice if customer service would either answer the phone or indicate what their holiday schedule is on their phone message (which says they should be open). I realize that these things happen, but did it have to happen on Christmas and to my child? It's a real shame to see her try so hard not to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Shipped with Dead Battery
Reviews.Author: William Gordon "badboy_4fun"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the camera shipped with a battery that is 100% not chargable.  Called tech support they promised to ship battery and charge 10 days later no battery or charger has arrived.  Called in today as I need battery as this was a Christmas gift.  Now I am told I need to fax in receipt and warranty card.I have to admit I was shocked that Amazon has no way to deal with this other then to send the whole camera back!!  I have been a long time Amazon customer and spent 50% of my Christmas budget here.  I have to say I was hugely disappointed that there isn't even a chat option for customer support.  I will be rethinking my purchases from Amazon from now on and for Electonic goods be purchasing from someone who can help incase there is an issue like this.  Crazy that I need to pay shipping and send camera back for such a simple issue!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Design
Reviews.Author: Keith Foster
Reviews.Content: I like camera and charger design.  i had 3mp canon camera was suck.  canon camera is too small and heavy.  it's only last one year.  the screen starts fuzzy then broken.  when u charge the battery, u have to take out battery from camera.  don't buy canon, wrong choice.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm sucks
Reviews.Author: Rivoo Malik
Reviews.Content: I get Fujifilm camera as a gift. Within 3-4 months of buying it, the flash stopped working. I sent it back as it was under warranty. Fujifilm agreed to repair the flash for $60. They said the lower end of the camera had minor scratch. Pray tell me..how does it impact the flash? Customer service was sooo poor. I was badly disaapointed. Save your money & buy a Canon or Nikon. FUJIFILM DO NOT HONOUR THEIR WARRANTY.

Reviews.Title: Porn downloads with this camera, Watch out!
Reviews.Author: Moose
Reviews.Content: We gave this camera to my 16 year old daughter for her Christmas present.  She decided to download the software so she could play with her picture.  Lo and behold 3 porn websites downloaded along with pictures onto our computer screen along with the camera software.  So disturbing!!!  Becareful if you bought this camera!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: the camera
Reviews.Author: Luis A. Sandoval "luis"
Reviews.Content: the camera is nice, small, good to the touch, the pictures are good. the only thing i didn't like was that it doesn't have a lot of features, for example the red light( lacier )on the front of the camera. that helps when you want to take pictures at a club or some where dark. the other thing i didn't like was the shipping, i pick the free 5-9 days but it took about 17 days for it to deliver. so if you want it for a special occasion try to pick the one or two day. after all the camera is good, for the money, but i would like it to have more features.

Reviews.Title: I don't own one... but
Reviews.Author: Alex Fielding
Reviews.Content: I was curious about this camera and I am guessing it is probably a nice unit. Fuji is a respected name in photography. The problem I have is with the 7 reviews, all 5's. Each one sounds like it was scripted to accentuate how wonderful the camera is, including a detailed list of its great features, much like a professional advertisement. One or two like this I can accept, but not all seven. I'll wait until some more less biased sounding reviews hit before I take too much stock in these current reviews. Footnote: I got a little lazy when I wrote this review and when I went back later to look at the other reviews I could see that only a few actually looked a little too stylistic. Sorry. Since then, a lot more people have left varying reviews and all in all it looks like a nice unit. I appreciate the feedback from the reviewers who hadn't actually purchased the camera- now I know that this kind of reviewing can be unbiased.
